Door jador exhibition was nice
Couldn't find it even after going in the wrong building and asking for directions. For what I can tell, nice exterior
Nice ambience, the text and colours of the descriptions should be at a level where it is friendly to the eyes.
Free (donation) entrance to nice expositions
Nice

The Dior J‚Äôadore promotional exhibition was exceptional! The feeling of being a VIP in an environment that I love so much, halfway between cosmetics and art, against a backdrop of the smell of my childhood. Well done !

Beautiful ephemeral exhibition around the J‚ÄôAdore perfume by Dior ‚ú® Beautiful pieces, whether for the archives of dresses, accessories, or even for the numerous variations of bottles of the famous perfume. Do not hesitate to ask the people present on site to obtain additional information. Exhibition until October 8, 2023.

10/12/2023 = exceptional temporary exhibition of the j'Adore perfume by DIOR. An incredible scenography. Magnificent videos and projections. A demonstration workshop of the little golden hands of the workshops for making perfume bottles. At the exit distribution of perfume samples. Congratulations to the LVMH group, the DIOR brand and Mr. Bernard ARNAULT for this visit, a real moment of happiness.

‚ÄúV√©g√©tal‚Äù A magnificent exhibition from Chaumet, where art and nature are intimately intertwined. Helpful, available and attentive guides in each room will attract your attention and bring to your memory fragments of the great and small stories of France. I invite you to go to this exhibition with your eyes... wide open! As for the price of the ticket, it is your free choice between 2, 5 or 10 euros... Original and relevant!

A pleasant setting for an interesting Expo when you like doodling. Works by ancient painters and other current, even controversial ones. We understand Thombly better. For Michaux, we like it or not. The ancient scribbled Latin books are a treasure to behold. You can take your time in this museum without being rushed by the crowds, which is very nice. A very pleasant welcome by very attentive staff. And a place in Paris to see just for the pleasure of walking on the banks of the Seine.

It really is a magnificent place. The glass roof, the sculptures. A must see! At the moment there is a free exhibition "we paint". Another exhibition is proposed and the price is chosen as desired (‚Ç¨2, ‚Ç¨5 or ‚Ç¨10). Original !!

Magnificent historic and baroque place a stone's throw from the center of Paris on the banks of the Seine! Beautiful staircases and paved interior courtyard where you can see students and artistic essays!
The Dior exhibition is truly a gem! I highly recommend even if places are quite limited
J adore by Dior exhibition. Magnificent, it‚Äôs a real eye-catcher to see ‚ù§Ô∏è
Very happy to have been able to attend the Dior exhibition in this small museum.
Shown open on Google, but building closed. After touring the length and breadth of the building, I tried to ask the school of fine arts for information: no one was able to give me any information.
Dior j‚Äôadore exhibition until October 8, 2023. Beautiful immersive experience. Discovering the gold of j'adore üíï a creation by Francis Kurkdjian. ‚Ä¶

As I was going up these stairs, a lovely young woman (from the Chaumet exhibition staff it seems) was coming down and said to me with a smile: ‚ÄúWhat elegance, sir!‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou have to live up to the standards of the place‚Ä¶‚Äù, I replied, no less smiling and joining, step by step, the gesture to the word. üôÇ  Thank you to Maison Chaumet and the exhibition staff for this delicious, delicate and oh-so-damantine moment! ‚ú®
Very warm welcome, beautiful places and very good artists exhibiting

Although the museum is quite small, the exhibitions are very interesting to say the least, between the reliefs, the numerous paintings and sculptures centered on religion.  Finally, a very interesting exhibition on works made about women. Most of them are magnificent and deserve to be more exposed and en masse.
Currently on view is the LE V√âG√âTAL exhibition by CHAUMET.  Gorgeous
superb Dior J‚Äôadore exhibition
The Quai Malaquais side is currently hosting the V√©g√©tal exhibition. Beautiful pieces, some of which are exceptional, unfold harmoniously in a beautiful setting.

I visited the DIOR J'ADORE exhibition, the perfume is very well displayed in each room (old and new bottles) and also in a room of haute couture dresses that you can admire. Very warm welcome from the staff.
Chaumet exhibition nice but lacks staging

Extremely beautiful, impressive space. The J‚Äôadore exhibition was perfectly well designed for such a place. Unfortunately there were too many people it was impossible to enjoy it! It was a big shame, too many people there to be seen and not to see. Too many selfies.

Fortunately I visited the ‚ÄúGribouillages‚Äù exhibition with a lecturer, because otherwise I would not have understood the meaning of this exhibition as well as the ‚Äúworks‚Äù on display. We must not exaggerate, each artist does "studies" before setting out definitively to achieve what he had in mind, but if the studies give the right to an exhibition, to happiness......

I discovered the Beaux-Arts exhibition center during the ‚ÄúV√©g√©tal‚Äù exhibition and I left so amazed that I plan to return there soon. The exhibition is magnificent, the mixture of arts (jewelry, painting, music, drawings, poetry of the explanations at the entrance to each room and the quotes on the walls...) beautifully treated, the explanations clear and understandable for all. Reservation is simple, the price accessible to all (for once, art is not reserved for the wealthiest, well done!). The guides in the different rooms are also wonderful: welcoming, pleasant, proactive and truly knowledgeable about the works of art presented. In short, a treat from start to finish; I highly recommend!

The building is currently under construction so I haven't had the chance to see this place in its entirety. I can talk about the current exhibition organized by Chaumet ‚Äúvegetal‚Äù which is very rich. As a lover of the plant world, you will find it transcribed in the form of jewelry, painting, scientific or non-scientific drawings, sculptures, paintings. This exhibition is worth the detour and is also free!

An exhibition of very uneven level and impact. Surprisingly, "provincial schools" (Besan√ßon, for example) sometimes have much more convincing productions from their students.... There remains, of course, the partial visit to the premises of the Paris School of Fine Arts which are exceptional!
Dior I love exhibition. With reservation, no long queues for entry, well-designed exhibition. We'll give you a poster and a Dior j'adore sample at the exit.
Very beautiful museum. We saw the exhibition on the creation of Place Stanislas, this reminder of the history of Nancy was very interesting. The Daum, Gall√©, Baccarat collections...are enchanting.
Superb exhibition. The staging is brilliant and hyper immersive. Too bad we can't see the fashion pieces very well (too far away for some)

Gorgeous jewelry of course. But there are all ways of representing plants: paintings, drawings, ceramics, tapestry...and of course again and again jewelry. Superb exhibition which must have required a lot of preparation work. A success
We went there as part of the Plant Exhibition. An excellent exhibition with proposals of works, each more exceptional than the last. The welcome was warm and the staff respectful.

The place is worth the detour: open exceptionally for a magnificent temporary exhibition ("V√©g√©tal", until the very beginning of September 2022), it is usually devoted to the Beaux Arts de Paris courses.

Magnificent building! And above all superb exhibitions with numerous explanations and if you have any questions the staff is there to answer them! Still a downside, the reception of the public needs to be reviewed for some with totally inappropriate reflections.
